alert.note: Alert for Greene; Lenoir; Pitt (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 15 at 10:11AM EST until January 16 at 1:00PM EST by NWS Newport/Morehead City
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in North Carolina... Contentnea Creek Near Hookerton affecting Lenoir, Greene and Pitt Counties. For the Contentnea Creek...including Hookerton...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL EARLY TOMORROW AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Contentnea Creek near Hookerton. * WHEN...Until early tomorrow afternoon. * IMPACTS...At 13.0 feet, Minor flooding of low lying areas adjacent to creek can be expected. Several homes threatened by water in northwest Greene County near HWY 58. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 9:00 AM EST Monday the stage was 13.0 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 9:00 AM EST Monday was 13.0 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall below flood stage tomorrow morning and continue falling to 12.4 feet Saturday morning. - Flood stage is 13.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at water.weather.gov/ahps. The next statement will be issued late tonight at 115 AM EST.
